DOC.brief_summary: This single arm, open-label study will assess the safety and efficacy with regar d to reduction of signs and symptoms of treatment with tocilizumab in combinatio n with methotrexate, in patients with moderate to severe active rheumatoid arthr itis. Patients will receive tocilizumab 8mg/kg iv, every 4 weeks and methotrexat e 10-25mg weekly. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months, and th e target sample size is <500 individuals.
DOC.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Effect of Tocilizumab Plus Methotrexate on Safety and Signs and Symptoms in Patients With Moderate to Severe Active Rheumatoid Arthritis
DOC.criteria: patients >=18 years with moderate to severe active RA for at least 6 months; swollen joint count >=6 (66 joint count) and tender joint count >=8 (68 joint count) at screening; inadequate response to stable dose of MTX; patients of reproductive potential must be using a reliable means of contraception. rheumatic autoimmune disease other than RA; patients with functional class IV RA; diagnosis of juvenile idiopathic or rheumatoid arthritis before age 16 or a history of current inflammatory joint disease other than RA; prior treatment failure with antitumor necrosis factor agent; pregnant or breastfeeding women.
